pr_title: KAFKA-9966: add internal assignment listener to stabilize eos-beta upgrade test

timeline.message: refactor AssignorConfiguration some, add listener for callback
refactor AssignorConfiguration some, add listener for callback

timeline.bodyText: This is the only non-cosmetic change in this class, along with the interface added below
timeline.author: ableegoldman

timeline.bodyText: Sorry for all the lines of changes here, but the inconsistent method signatures and object construction was making this class hard to follow. All I'm doing here is making the methods conform to the same style, and moving the construction of any config that isn't needed elsewhere to its getter method. This allows us to remove a lot of these class variables
timeline.author: ableegoldman

replies.bodyText: Do we know if the corresponding "getters" are called often or not? I guess the main idea behind having those member variables was to "parse" the config once as it's immutable anyway instead of each time a getter is called?
replies.author: mjsax

replies.bodyText: They are not. We construct the AssignorConfiguration object once in StreamsPartitionAssignor#configure and call the getters immediately afterwards, and only there
replies.author: ableegoldman

timeline.bodyText: This one actually might not be necessary, but I thought it was useful as a sanity check especially since we're trying to access the stores in some places
timeline.author: ableegoldman

timeline.bodyText:
Seems this could fail if observed is empty?
Also, could we simplify this? We are only interested in RUNNING  state, right? So no need to check the previous state?
timeline.author: mjsax

replies.bodyText: If we don't configure the TaskManager then we'll throw (the wrong kind of) exception during configure. Previously this test just happened to pass because we processed the user endpoint before we processed the TaskManager, so we never got to the TaskManager
replies.author: ableegoldman

timeline.bodyText: So far we always pass in assignmentListener.numStableAssignments() + 1 -- hence, I am wondering if we need to pass it at all?
timeline.author: mjsax

replies.bodyText: Well we need to record it before doing whatever action causes the group to rebalance. But maybe we can do something like prepareForRebalance if that seems easier?
replies.author: ableegoldman

replies.bodyText: I see. Guess it's good as-is.
replies.author: mjsax

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need this? If we don't inject an error, we start phase 6 in RUNNING state and it should not rebalance.
timeline.author: mjsax
